qas.question: Who conquered the Eastern Provinces of the Byzantine empire?
In Syria and Egypt, other than early Christians, who influenced their mosaic work?
What would later become the main Islamic form of wall decoration?
The Umayyad Dynasty made mosaic making do what in the Islamic culture?

context: Islamic architecture used mosaic technique to decorate religious buildings and palaces after the <a0_0>Muslim<a0_0/> conquests of the eastern provinces of the Byzantine Empire. In Syria and Egypt the Arabs were influenced by the great tradition of <a1_0>Roman<a1_0/> and Early Christian mosaic art. During the Umayyad Dynasty mosaic making <a3_0>remained a flourishing art form<a3_0/> in Islamic culture and it is continued in the art of zellige and azulejo in various parts of the Arab world, although <a2_0>tile<a2_0/> was to become the main Islamic form of wall decoration.
